div.div: Distribution of Children's Face Masks Free children's masks are available for pick up at our lunch distribution site at Islip High School. The masks come in "grab and go" bags of three masks and will be available today (Thursday, April 23) and tomorrow (Friday, April 24) during the regular distribution hours of 10:00 a.m. and noon.

div.p: The Seatuck Environmental Association's annual Eco-Carnival was canceled this year, but the organization is instead offering a stay-at-home, celebrate-in-place, social-distancing-friendly Digital Eco-Carnival.

The event will include all of the things that makes the Eco-Carnival Long Island's premier Earth Day celebration: hands-on nature explorations, nature-based games, live music, a live animal show, and fun outdoor activities for children of all ages.

The Carnival will run digitally as a live feed on Seatuck's Facebook Page on April 25 from 11 a.m.-4 p.m.
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Seatuck-Environmental-Association/33653519590

img.alt: Seatuck’s Eco-Carnival Goes Digital thumbnail168784

div.h3: HS Video Production Class Needs Your Vote

div.p:
Please vote and pass along the below link to everyone you know.
Islip High School's video production students are once again Long Island Finalists in the Teen Awareness Public Service Announcement Competition sponsored by The Greatest Save organization and Major League Baseball. We are a small school and WE NEED YOUR VOTES. Below is a link to vote and view the Long Island Finalist videos. Vote as many times as you can on as many devices (phone, PC, Mac, iPad etc.), as well as different browsers (Explorer, Firefox, Google). Regional winners move onto a national competition in which the winners will receive a scholarship prize.

Click on this link to vote for Islip (our videos are numbers 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6):
https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/LIslandPSAs

img.alt: MailTo Islip School District - Census 2020
img.title: MailTo Share Button

div.div:
By now, all residents in Islip should have received a letter from the U.S. Census Bureau with instructions to complete the 2020 Census questionnaire online, as well as a Census ID for the household.
Completing the U.S. Census is one of the most important steps a parent and the community can take to secure the future of the District's students. Your responses ensure accurate counts which will set funding levels for schools, special education services, health insurance, food distribution programs, and much more for the next TEN YEARS. If the District is undercounted, it would mean less funding from the federal government and less representation in the House of Representative, lessening the community's voice. Therefore, when completing the Census, it is important to count EVERYONE in your household, including infants and toddlers.
Every child on Long Island deserves the opportunity to succeed. By taking ten minutes to complete the 2020 U.S. Census, you are helping provide them with that chance. If you have questions before you begin, please visit the Help & FAQs page of the U.S. Census website for more information.
